title: Bug 6410: File unchanged but dirtied by code assist
description: Bug 6410: File unchanged but dirtied by code assist
OB: When the code assist feature has nothing to suggest, it still causes the file to be marked as modified (dirty) in the software, even though no changes have been made to the file.
EB: If code assist has nothing to suggest, it should not mark the file as modified.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open a Java file. 
2. Place the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call. 
3. For example, consider "I" to be the cursor below: 
   Object o = anotherObject.method(I); 
4. Press Ctrl + Space.
